qas.question: At which period of the year are phosphates high?
What causes sugar created by chlorophyll to breakdown?
Where does phosphate within a leaf move in the fall?
What is created in fall when phosphates retreat to the stems of plants?
What occurs in bright light to leaves during fall?
What does chlorophyll have a vital role in breaking down?
What moves from the leaf into the stem during the summer?
What does the chloropyll breakdown process lead to?

plausible_answers.text: phosphate, along with the other chemicals and nutrients, moves out of the leaf into the stem of the plant

qas.question: What leads to the production of anthocyanin chlorophyll pigments?

context: During <a0_0>the summer growing season<a0_0/>, <a1_0><b6_0>phosphate<b6_0/><a1_0/> is at a high level. It has a vital role in the breakdown of the <b5_0>sugars<b5_0/> manufactured by chlorophyll. But in the fall, <b8_0>phosphate, along with the other chemicals and nutrients, moves out of the leaf into <a2_0>the stem of the plant<b8_0/><a2_0/>. When this happens, the sugar-breakdown process changes, leading to <b7_0>the production of <a3_0>anthocyanin pigments<b7_0/><a3_0/>. The brighter the light during this period, the <a4_0>greater the production of anthocyanins<a4_0/> and the more brilliant the resulting color display. When the days of autumn are bright and cool, and the nights are chilly but not freezing, the brightest colorations usually develop.
